bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, July 10, 1928

div1.p: Russell asks Carter for an approximate idea of when her work will be completed.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, July 10, 1928
div1.opener:
SELSKAR M. GUNN, VICE PRESIDENT
IN EUROPE
ROGER S. GREENE, VICE PRESIDENT
IN FAR EAST
---
ASSOCIATE DIRECTORS
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
WILBUR A. SAWYER, M.D.
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES
GEORGE E. VINCENT
PRESIDENT
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH DIVISION
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D., DIRECTOR
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “ROCKFOUND”
NORMA S. THOMPSON, SECRETARY
L. G. MYERS, TREASURER
GEORGE J. BEAL, COMPTROLLER
---
TRUSTEES DIVISIONAL COMMITTEE
THE PRESIDENT
SIMON FLEXNER
VERNON KELLOGG
WICKLIFFE ROSE
WILLIAM ALLEN WHITE
July 10, 1928.
Dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
I thank you for your note of the 9th of July.
I am glad that you have seen Colonel Ashburn and that
you have made arrangements for work at the S.G.O.

I wish that some time in the near future you
would send me an estimate of the time that you think
will be necessary before the work is finished. I know
that it will be difficult to be exact, but all I need for
the present is a rough estimate so that plans may be made.

I received the announcement of the marriage of
Miss Darling, and I am writing Mrs. Darling my congratulations.
div1.closer:
With best wishes, I am
Very sincerely yours, F F Russell Miss Laura Carter
The Westmoreland
2122 California Street NW
Washington, D.C.
FFR:DH
Copy to Dr. Frost
